titleStmt.title: Three to one being, an English-Spanish combat, performed by a westerne gentleman, of Tauystoke in Deuon shire with an English quarter-staffe, against three Spanish rapiers and poniards, at Sherries in Spaine, the fifteene day of Nouember, 1625. In the presence of dukes, condes, marquesses, and other great dons of Spaine, being the counsell of warre. The author of this booke, and actor in this encounter, Richard Peeeke [sic].
titleStmt.author: Pike, Richard, fl. 1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Augustine Mathewes] for I[ohn] T[rundle],

notesStmt.note: Printer's and publisher's names from STC.
"Certaine verses, vvritten by a friend, in comendations of the author Richard Peeke", E2-3.
This edition has signatures: A-E⁴ (-A1, E4).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
